posts.post_content: This is a land cycling card, not a creature. If it wasn't more expensive than it was worth it would be overpowered. Then, say, if you have more than enough lands and you don't need a land cycling card later in the game, it is still somewhat useful as a creature if drawn. a 2/4 creature with fear, which may be able to act as that one blocker you need to stay alive or sneak in that little bit of damage you needed to snatch a victory from defeat. Dual use cards are pretty nice, and I'm somewhat surprised at the one-sided reviews it is getting. Any zombie deck in standard should be running four of these as a staple for getting the mana you need to win.
posts.html:
This is a land cycling card, not a creature. If it wasn't more expensive than it was worth it would be overpowered. Then, say, if you have more than enough lands and you don't need a land cycling card later in the game, it is still somewhat useful as a creature if drawn. a 2/4 creature with fear, which may be able to act as that one blocker you need to stay alive or sneak in that little bit of damage you needed to snatch a victory from defeat. Dual use cards are pretty nice, and I'm somewhat surprised at the one-sided reviews it is getting. Any zombie deck in standard should be running four of these as a staple for getting the mana you need to win.

Posted By: Gwafa_Hazid (9/29/2010 6:10:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At half a glance, it's CC is rubbish... but it's got Island AND Swamp cycling, AND Fear, AND it's a Zombie.
  
   
There are great perks to using this in a U/B Zombie deck. In the company of cards such as [Zombify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombify), [Death Baron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Baron), and [Avatar of Woe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avatar of Woe) the advantages FAR outweigh the gripes if you ask me. The 6 CC is way too high to pay straight up,... so, cycle him, then rise him from the grave and get a Death Baron or a Cemetery Reaper in play. Think outside the box.
  
   
Also, i LIKE the art a lot! Ordered two of these for xmas.
posts.html:
At half a glance, it's CC is rubbish... but it's got Island AND Swamp cycling, AND Fear, AND it's a Zombie.

There are great perks to using this in a U/B Zombie deck. In the company of cards such as Zombify, Death Baron, and Avatar of Woe the advantages FAR outweigh the gripes if you ask me. The 6 CC is way too high to pay straight up,... so, cycle him, then rise him from the grave and get a Death Baron or a Cemetery Reaper in play. Think outside the box.

Also, i LIKE the art a lot! Ordered two of these for xmas.

Posted By: Hayw00d0909 (12/15/2010 11:22:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Why all the hate? In the proper deck, this is a very good card. It all depends what you use it for. I have it in a blue/black zombie-control deck and its very useful. Use it for cycling, toss it to the grave then raise it if you need it for cheaper...or just leave him there to get an Avatar of Woe faster ;) If you bring it back, its nice to boost Lich Lord of Unx's second ability. You'd be stupid to play it straight up for its cost.
posts.html:

Use it for cycling, toss it to the grave then raise it if you need it for cheaper...or just leave him there to get an Avatar of Woe faster ;) If you bring it back, its nice to boost Lich Lord of Unx's second ability. posts.post_content: @snyden: for a zombie deck, you'd add [twisted abomination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=twisted abomination), which is in each and every way better than this for zombie decks. And four swampcyclers are enough, so there'd be no reason to add the jhessian zombies. And if you need 8 landcyclers in your deck to keep it playable, rather add some actual mana acceleration to it, simply up the landcount.
